greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of aperiodic binary toroidal necklaces of size n.
comment: We define a toroidal necklace to be an equivalence class of matrices under all possible rotations of the sequence of rows and the sequence of columns. An n X k matrix is aperiodic if all n * k rotations of its sequence of rows and its sequence of columns are distinct.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
S. N. Ethier, Counting toroidal binary arrays, J. Int. Seq. 16 (2013) #13.4.7.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} A323861(d, n/d) for n > 0. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 21 2019
example: Inequivalent representatives of the a(6) = 36 aperiodic necklaces:
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Feb 04 2019
ext: Terms a(19) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 21 2019
